data.text: The Proverbs of Solomon son of David,
To know wisdom and instruction,
To receive also hard sayings,
That he might give subtlety to the simple,
For by the hearing of these a wise man will be wiser,
And will understand a parable, and a dark speech;
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom;
Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father,
For thou shalt receive for thy head a crown of graces,
My son, let not ungodly men lead thee astray,
If they should exhort thee, saying, Come with us, partake in blood,
And let us swallow him alive, as Hades would,
Let us seize on his valuable property,
But do thou cast in thy lot with us,
Go not in the way with them,
For nets are not without cause spread for birds.
For they that are concerned in murder store up evils for themselves;
These are the ways of all that perform lawless deeds;
Wisdom sings aloud in passages,
And she makes proclamation on the top of the walls,
So long as the simple cleave to justice, they shall not be ashamed:
Behold, I will bring forth to you the utterance of my breath,
Since I called, and ye did not hearken;
But ye set at nought my counsels,
Therefore I also will laugh at your destruction;
Yea when dismay suddenly comes upon you,
For it shall be that when ye call upon me, I will not hearken to you:
For they hated wisdom,
Neither would they attend to my counsels,
Therefore shall they eat the fruits of their own way,
For because they wronged the simple, they shall be slain;
But he that hearkens to me shall dwell in confidence,
